channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How a NASM certification can kickstart your personal training career
item.description: As the need for fitness trainers and instructors grows, a NASM certification can be your entry point into a dynamic and in-demand field.

item.title: Organized retail theft ring that targeted Macy's, other retailers is charged in New York
item.description: Two New Yorkers were charged with possessing and reselling more than $1 million in stolen goods through their business in Midtown Manhattan.

item.title: A 35-year-old junior Bank of America associate suddenly died—and it’s ignited discussions about Wall Street’s intense working conditions
item.description: Leo Lukenas III, a former Green Beret, joined Bank of America as an investment banker last summer. He died on May 2.

item.title: Airbnb beats earnings expectations for first quarter but offers weaker-than-expected guidance
item.description: Airbnb reported first-quarter results on Wednesday that beat analysts' estimates.

item.title: CEO Dara Khosrowshahi wants more workers to return to the office—preferably in an Uber
item.description: After a full year of profitability, Uber reported a first quarter loss and its CEO blames a lack of commuters post-pandemic.

item.title: Robinhood climbs after reporting record earnings for first quarter
item.description: Shares of the brokerage firm rose after first-quarter results topped Wall Street expectations.

item.title: Panera is ditching its Charged Lemonade after 2 customers died—but Gen Z is still thirsting for dangerous snacks and drinks
item.description: A 30-ounce Charged Lemonade reportedly contained 390 milligrams of caffeine, the equivalent of about five Red Bulls.

item.title: These stocks struggling over the past month are primed for a comeback
item.description: A slate of names that have suffered recently could be poised for a rebound.

item.title: The UK’s second-richest man is demanding Manchester United workers return to the office—’If you don’t like it, please seek alternative employment’
item.description: Even if workers prefer flexibility, executives are getting impatient.

item.title: Rates on federal student loans may increase by 1 percentage point: ‘A fairly big jump,’ expert says
item.description: The interest rates on federal student loan rates will likely rise by about 1 percentage point in the 2024-2025 academic year. Here's what to know.
